intro: Rhodiola atsaensis, commonly known as the Mongolian rhodiola, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. It is well adapted to harsh environments, including high altitudes and cold climates. Rhodiola atsaensis is often found in rocky soils and is valued for its potential medicinal properties.
